Title: Using Azure Managed identities
Description: Azure Managed Identity provides an identity for applications to use when connecting to resources. In this episode, Varun joins Christos to show us how us how to use managed identity along with the Azu

Title: WhatsApp to restrict features if you refuse Facebook data sharing
Description: WhatsApp says that it will not delete or deactivate the accounts of users who oppose its latest privacy policy update that requires sharing data with Facebook companies.

Title: How we built an idea engine in Slack
Description: A high-level overview of how we process, evaluate, and use team ideas at Butter

Title: The MVP Process
Description: Today we are going to take a look at the MVP process that we follow at Zynath. It may differ in some details from the standard agile development methodology you are familiar with. The traditional approach works great for pure software startups with little to no immediate regulatory concerns.

Title: Learning to build — Essays
Description: As a product manager, did you ever wish you could quickly prototype an idea you had for a product? build something for fun over a weekend? Title: How Gravity Is a Double Copy of Other Forces | Quanta Magazine
Description: An enigmatic connection between the forces of nature is allowing physicists to explore gravity’s quantum side.

Title: 25 years of OCaml - Community - OCaml
Description: 25 years ago, on May 9th 1996, release 1.00 of the Objective Caml language and system was announced: https://sympa.inria.fr/sympa/arc/caml-list/1996-05/msg00003.html  It was already the consolidation of many years of work, integrating Jérôme Vouillon and Didier Rémy’s work on objects and classes within Caml Special Light, itself a combination of my work on modules and native-code compilation with earlier code taken from Caml Light, especially Damien Doligez’s GC.  Little did I know that O(bjecti...

Title: KalkiCode | Learn Programming
Description: Data structure and algorithm based problem and solutions, Learn about the concepts of programming language by using tutorials and articles, Which is useful in competitive programming practice

Title: How we upgrade a live data center
Description: A few weeks ago we upgraded a lot of the core infrastructure in our New York (okay, it’s really in New Jersey now – but don’t tell anyone) data center. We love being open with everything we do (including infrastructure), and really consider it one of the best job perks we have. So here’s how and why we upgrade a data center. First, take a moment to look at what Stack Overflow started as. It’s 5 years later and hardware has come a long way.

Title: How I Practice Piano
Description: This is my usual method of practicing, gleaned from my teacher, old posts on the Piano Street forums, Graham Fitch’s Practising the Piano, and various other books and resources. It’s ra…

Title: Microsoft Announces Preview Service for Building Real-Time Web Applications Called Azure Web PubSub
Description: Recently Microsoft announced a preview of Azure Web PubSub, a new service for building real-time web applications. Azure Web PubSub is a fully-managed service that supports native and serverless WebSockets.

Title: The Mortifying Ordeal of Pairing All Day
Description: I had to confront a lot of my fears about myself, sometimes every day. I had to learn to show someone else all the things I didn’t know, my limitations as a human and a software engineer.

Title: Distributed Tracing in ASP.NET Core with Jaeger and Tye Part 2 - Project Tye
Description:
In this series:
 Distributed Tracing with Jaeger Simplifying the setup with Tye (this article)   Tye is an experimental dotnet tool from Microsoft that aims to make developing, testing, and deploying microservices easier. Tye’s opinionated nature greatly simplifies the lifecycle of development and deployment of .NET Core microservices.
To understand the benefits of Tye, let’s enumerate the steps involved in the development and deployment of the DCalculator application to Kubernetes:

Title: If I fits I sits: A citizen science investigation into illusory contour susceptibility in domestic cats (Felis silvestris catus)

Title: Linux Foundation starts AgStack, world's first open-source agtech initiative
Description: Open source tech non-profit launches AgStack, the first project aimed at open digital infrastructure for global farming and agriculture.
